intro: Reseda migiurtinorum, commonly known as the African oxydendrum, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Reseda migiurtinorum is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
